tintangsg wrote:
> Hi,
> We would like to use Heritrix in an application running in jdk1.4.2, 
> could Heritrix developers let us know:
> 1. Can we get the latest Heritrix running in jdk1.4.2? What changes 
> are needed? If that is not possible, pls go to question 2.

We started using JDK1.5 features after the Heritrix 1.8.0 release.

Getting the latest release (1.10.1) or CVS HEAD to work in JDK 1.4.2 
should be possible but it would take some significant effort, and you'd 
be off the mainline for fixes and features.

> 2. What is the latest version of Heritrix that can be run in jdk1.4.2? 
> Does that version have a lot of bugs?

As noted above, 1.8.0.

Lots of big and successful crawls were done with 1.8.0 and earlier 
versions, but it had bugs and other limitations since fixed. See the 
issue tracking at Sourceforge or release notes (at 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/releasenotes/ ) for details.

It would depend a lot on your aims. You could also consider keeping the 
crawling functionality in a separate JVM, remote-controlled by the other 
application, if that application is forced to stay in JDK1.4.2.

Hope this helps,

- Gordon @ IA

> Thanks a lot,
> Tim
